title: Cycling Plus Summer issue on sale now! Subscribe and receive a free Ritchey Comp Skyline saddle worth £47.99
content:
In the Summer edition of Cycling Plus the team delves into the fruitful world of aerodynamics to test four of the most slippery bikes available today. Experience a first ride of Condor’s Super Acciaio Disc, test Zipp’s 303 Firecrest wheels and strap on eight pairs of the best shoes for gravel riding.

Cycling Plus examines the mental trickery of comeback king Primož Roglič and go on the hunt for wild food in Somerset with foraging king David Hamilton.

It’s almost time for the Tour de France and this month Cycling Plus has its annual 36-page guide previewing the 108th edition of the great race.

  • Subscribe to Cycling Plus to receive your free gift as well as discounts and more

How fast can you go?

Let’s be honest, going fast is one of the reasons a lot of us starting riding bikes and in this four-bike race to the finish line, the Cycling Plus team test a quartet of fast movers from Vitus, Cannondale, Scott and Felt to see which one pips at the post.

Wild riding

Cycling Plus’s features editor, John Whitney, goes on a wild ride with forager David Hamilton and cooks up the results on a Somerset beach.

Rough minded

If you’re planning some excursions off the well-trodden path and onto rougher trails then make sure you’re shod appropriately with Cycling Plus’s test of eight of the best shoes on the shelf, with a guide of what to look for.

La Grande Boucle

The long-awaited Tour de France returns at the end of June and the Cycling Plus team has created a comprehensive guide to all the stages and asks the burning question on everyone’s lips: ‘Can anyone stop the Slovenians?’.
